meanings.sent1: The thief cabbaged the jewels from the museum.
meanings.sent2: He cabbaged money from unsuspecting victims on the street.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous raccoon cabbaged snacks from the picnic basket.
meanings.sent4: The sly fox cabbaged eggs from the henhouse under the moonlight.
meanings.sent5: The pirate cabbaged treasures from the sunken ship with great skill.

meanings.definition: To be in a state of disrepair or ruin
meanings.sent1: The old house looked cabbaged with its broken windows and crumbling walls.
meanings.sent2: After the storm, the garden was cabbaged with fallen trees and scattered debris.
meanings.sent3: The abandoned car in the field appeared cabbaged with rust and overgrown weeds.
meanings.sent4: The neglected playground equipment cabbaged in the corner of the park.
meanings.sent5: The once beautiful castle now cabbaged in the mist of neglect and time.

meanings.definition: To be extremely tired or exhausted
meanings.sent1: After the long hike, the hikers were cabbaged and collapsed on the ground.
meanings.sent2: Working overtime every day left him cabbaged by the end of the week.
meanings.sent3: The marathon runner felt cabbaged as he crossed the finish line.
meanings.sent4: Studying for exams all night made the students cabbaged the next day.
meanings.sent5: The farmer was cabbaged after a day of harvesting under the scorching sun.
